org.jcvi.jillion.core.residue.nt

Interface NucleotideSequence

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Nucleotide>, ResidueSequence<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideSequenceBuilder>, Sequence<Nucleotide>, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ReferenceMappedNucleotideSequence

    public interface NucleotideSequence
extends ResidueSequence<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideSequenceBuilder>, Serializable
    NucleotideSequence an interface to abstract how a Sequence of Nucleotides are encoded in memory. Nucleotide data can be stored in many different ways depending on the use case and size and composition of the sequence. Different encoding implementations can take up more or less memory or require more computations to decode. This interface hides implementation details regarding the decoding so users don't have to worry about it.
    NucleotideSequence is Serializable in a (hopefully) forwards compatible way. However, there is no guarantee that the implementation will be the same or even that the implementation class will be the same; but the deserialized object should always be equal to the sequence that was serialized.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object o)
        Two NucleotideSequences are equal if they contain the same Nucleotides in the same order.

        Two ResidueSequences are equal if they contain the same residues in the same order. Two sequences should be equal if they are both the same length and contain the same elements in the same order..

        Specified by:
        equals in interface ResidueSequence<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideSequenceBuilder>

        int hashCode()
        The HashCode of a ResidueSequence is computed by summing the hashcodes of the residues of this sequence in sequential order.

      • toBuilder

        NucleotideSequenceBuilder toBuilder()
        Creates a new NucleotideSequenceBuilder object.
        Specified by:
        toBuilder in interface ResidueSequence<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideSequenceBuilder>
        Specified by:
        toBuilder in interface Sequence<Nucleotide>
        Implementation Requirements:
        This is the same as 
         return  new NucleotideSequenceBuilder(this)
        Implementation Note:
        Implementations of this method should add any additional settings or flags to optimize the Builder to that the final built Sequence should be the same class with the same optimization characteristics as this Sequence instance. For example, a ReferenceMappedNucleotideSequence should make a builder that uses the same reference.
        Returns:
        a new NucleotideSequenceBuilder instance initialized to the this Sequence; will never be null but may be empty.
        Since:
        5.0

      • findMatches

        default Stream<Range> findMatches(String regex)
        Find all the Ranges in this sequence that match the given regular expression Pattern.
        API Note:
        this is the same as findMatches(Pattern.compile(regex));
        Parameters:
        regex - the regular expression pattern to look for. All bases must be in uppercase.
        Returns:
        a Stream of Range objects of the matches on this sequence.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        findMatches(Pattern)

      • findMatches

        default Stream<Range> findMatches(String regex,
                                  Range subSequenceRange)
        Find the Ranges in this sequence within the specified sub sequence range that match the given regular expression.
        API Note:
        this is the same as findMatches(Pattern.compile(regex), subSequenceRange);
        Parameters:
        regex - the pattern to look for. All bases must be in uppercase.
        subSequenceRange - the Range in the sequence to look for matches in.
        Returns:
        a Stream of Range objects of the matches on this sequence.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        findMatches(Pattern, Range)

      • findMatches

        Stream<Range> findMatches(Pattern pattern)
        Find all the Ranges in this sequence that match the given regular expression Pattern.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • findMatches

        Stream<Range> findMatches(Pattern pattern,
                          Range subSequenceRange)
        Find the Ranges in this sequence within the specified sub sequence range that match the given regular expression Pattern. NOTE All the Range coordinates returned in the Stream will be relative to the entire sequence.
        API Note:
        This should return the same result as : 
          sut.findMatches(pattern)
     .filter(r-> r.isSubRangeOf(subSequenceRange))
        But will be more efficient.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern to look for. All bases must be in uppercase.
        subSequenceRange - the Range in the sequence to look for matches in.
        Returns:
        a Stream of Range objects of the matches on this sequence.
        Since:
        5.3

      • getRangesOfNs

        List<Range> getRangesOfNs()
        Get the list of contiguous spans of Ns; the returned list will be in sorted order.
        Returns:
        a List which may be empty.
        Since:
        5.3
